Pre-Game Insights: England and Scotland's meeting in the group stages of the T20 World Cup 2024 will be the 2637th in the format's history, and just their sixth in total.
England is defending a global title, but their T20 outfit looks fit and firing despite a frustrating experience during their warm-up series against Pakistan.
Jofra Archer has never yet played an international on his home island of Barbados and will do so in front of his friends and family.
Mark Watt's performance in the 2022 T20 World Cup, where he conceded just 12 runs from four overs of left-arm spin, is expected to be crucial for Scotland.

England's recent experience of the Caribbean came in a six-laden showdown with the hosts in December, and anything that knocks their hard-hitting batters off their stride can only be a bonus for the underdogs.
England's rain-affected home series with Pakistan meant they were forced to compromise their intended preparations.
Scotland can draw on a strong squad with plenty of experience from the last two T20 World Cups.
England has never beaten a European nation at the T20 World Cup, losing to Netherlands in 2009 and 2014, and had the worst of two rain-affected clashes against Ireland in 2010 and 2022.
